metadata.title: CVE-2023-32373 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management. Thisissue is fixed in watchOS 9.5, tvOS 16.5, macOS Ventura 13.4, iOS 15.7.6and iPadOS 15.7.6, Safari 16.5, iOS 16.5 and iPadOS 16.5. Processingmaliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Appleis aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.40.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
